  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was being loaded into the van when it was discovered to be leaking by the ops manager. The manager called for QA to inspect the package. DescribePack: The lid to the bottle was loose, DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a lined bin and taken to QA.

item.title: Report X-2024031380
item.description:
Report X-2024031380

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet package found in trailer#900818 already damaged wet upon inspection of inner contents 2 x 2.5gallon plastic bottles of Convoclean forte one 2.5gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition DescribePack: one 2.5gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report X-2024031387
item.description:
Report X-2024031387

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: MUNCY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet by a package handler while being unloaded at night. The outbound manager placed the box in a hazmat bin and brought to qa to be processed. DescribePack: Package contained 2 bottles of convo clean forte but 1 bottle was leaking. Both lids appeared tight but 1 was leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Tightened lids and placed in hazmat bin.

item.title: Report X-2024031375
item.description:
Report X-2024031375

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-24
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager from unload called out leaking hazmats, there were total of 7 wet hazmat packages. They were brought to QA, I went to grab my PPE to inspect. DescribePack: This was the only box that was severely crushed that caused the liquid to come out of the vented caps of all the bottles. DurationRel: 48 and MitigateEffect: Kept the bottles upright

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered in the Unload. Upon investigation of package, plastic pail within fiberboard box had large crack in side. DescribePack: Large crack in side of plastic pail DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was secured in Hazardous materials bag and bin and kept in well ventilated areas until processed.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package started leaking on the load side, it was then placed in a tote and taken to QA. DescribePack: No package failure found; box was wet. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a tote and then a yellow drum.

item.title: Report X-2024031307
item.description:
Report X-2024031307

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-22
  • City: NEWVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought over to QA in a bag for hazardous materials and that in a red tote in the latter part of the morning sort. DescribePack: The box was not opened to determine how much actually spilled, but there was a hole in the one corner of the box where it was wet and it appeared that it came that way from the liquid inside the box. The company usually ships five one-gallon containers. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: The bag that the box was in was sealed with two zip ties. That bag was put in a blue hazmat bag which was placed in a yellow tote.

item.title: Report X-2024031401
item.description:
Report X-2024031401

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged hazmat was placed in a red hazardous material bin on the hazmat pallet in QA. There was a small pool of liquid in the red hazardous bin that leaked from the container. Grabbed my PPE to inspect the damage. DescribePack: At first, I do not see any visible damages to the container. The only thing I was able to identify where the leaks were coming from. It came from the seam at the bottom of the pail. DurationRel: 16 and MitigateEffect: The drum was left in plastic lined red hazardous material bin.

item.title: Report X-2024031230
item.description:
Report X-2024031230

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: MUNCY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: X-2024031230: SequenceEvent: Package was found by package handler while unloading a van at night. The package handler found that it was wet and alerted the manager. Manager then placed package upright and placed in hazmat pail. DescribePack: The package was loaded on its side by the driver. One bottle of low temp sani leaked due to being misloaded. About 10 ounces spilled out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed upright and put in hazmat pail. X-2024031232: SequenceEvent: Package handler found package on a van while unloading at night. Package handler informed manager of issue and manager placed package in hazmat pail to be processed. DescribePack: Package was loaded on its side by the driver. A bottle of convocleane forte had a small leak because of being misloaded. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed upright and in a hazmat pail to be processed.

item.title: Report X-2024031155
item.description:
Report X-2024031155

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-18
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered wet in the outbounds. Upon investigation, 16 Food Grade 35% Hydrogen Peroxide were secured within plastic bag, within fiberboard box. Contents within were tightly packaged together and from sortation and loose caps, trace amounts of contents led to internal leakage. Upon removal of bottles from outer packaging, contents were notice to have warning labels on bottles causing a subsidiary look up of SDS for bottle + contents. DescribePack: ~16 Loose Caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was secured and handle in hazardous materials bag and bin.

item.title: Report X-2024031161
item.description:
Report X-2024031161

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-18
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton ripped torn open and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 1 x 55lbs plastic pail/drum of Aqua-org. plus The 55lbs plastic pail/drum was bent dented cracked broken at the bottom of the plastic pail/drum causing leakage and allowing 5lbs to release. no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures of damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition DescribePack: package contained 1x55lbs plastic pail/drum that was cracked dented bent broken at the bottom allowing 5lbs to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report E-2024030314
item.description:
Report E-2024030314

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: MARCUS HOOK
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WHILE ENTERING THE CONSIGNEE FACILITY THE DRIVER REPORTED HIS BRAKING ACTION RESULTED IN PRODUCT RELEASE FROM FRONT WASHOUT CAP. INVESTIGATION SHOWED LOOSE CAP VIBRATION RESULTED IN RELEASE OF SMALL AMOUNT OF MATERIAL. CAP TIGHTENED SPILL CLEANED AND DELIVERY COMPLETED WITHOUT ADDITIONAL INCIDENT.
